Figure 1:We target real-time, interactive fluid simulations.
Our hybrid solver integrates a numerical simulator and neural physics (Section3.1), enabling real-time simulation (Section4.2).
In addition, we generate external force fields (Section3.2) to support users to control fluids interactively via freehand sketches (Section4.3).
Figure 2:GNN as our neural physics simulator.

Figure 3:Method Overview.
To achieve real-time simulations, we cut latency by learning neural physics at a coarse spatiotemporal resolution, while safeguarding fidelity by automatically falling back to an MPM solver when complex fluid phenomena arise (Section3.1).
For interactive control, we train a diffusion-based generative model that infers external force fields directly from user sketches (Section3.2).
